@graph.name: Blueberry Almond yeast Bread Loaf. vegan - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: This Blueberry Almond Bread is a yeast bread loaf. The berries and almonds make this a fantastic bread for french toasts or PB&J Sammies. Vegan

itemListElement.name: Blueberry Almond yeast Bread Loaf. vegan

@graph.name: This Blueberry Almond Bread
@graph.description: This Blueberry Almond Bread is a yeast bread loaf. The berries and almonds make this a fantastic bread for french toasts or PB&J Sammies
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup blueberries (I used fresh, use wild blueberries for a deeper color)
2 Tablespoons raw sugar or equivalent sweetener
2 Tablespoons organic canola oil or olive oil

recipeInstructions.text: Add the yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar to 2 Tablespoons warm water. Mix and let it sit until frothy. 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar to 2 Tablespoons warm water. Mix and let it sit until frothy. 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a stand mixer, add the flours, salt, rest of the sugar and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a stand mixer, add the flours, salt, rest of the sugar and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend blueberries, and 2-3 Tablespoons water, into a smooth puree.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend blueberries, and 2-3 Tablespoons water, into a smooth puree.

recipeInstructions.text: To the flours, Add in the blueberry puree , oil and yeast mixture and knead for 6-8 minutes. Scraping sides every 2-3 minutes. Or knead by hand for 5-6 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: To the flours, Add in the blueberry puree , oil and yeast mixture and knead for 6-8 minutes. Scraping sides every 2-3 minutes. Or knead by hand for 5-6 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add more water or bread flour if needed to make a well formed soft dough. The dough might be a little sticky, but should not be wet.
recipeInstructions.name: Add more water or bread flour if needed to make a well formed soft dough. The dough might be a little sticky, but should not be wet.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well greased container. Spray water on top, cover and let sit in a warm place for 1.5 hours or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well greased container. Spray water on top, cover and let sit in a warm place for 1.5 hours or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Take dough out on a working surface. Using a little bread flour, knead for a minute, and then flatten it out into an inch thick rectangle. Roll it up like a jelly roll. Seal the edges. Place the roll seam side down in a well greased or parchment lined bread pan. Spray water on top. Sprinkle a little flour. Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Take dough out on a working surface. Using a little bread flour, knead for a minute, and then flatten it out into an inch thick rectangle. Roll it up like a jelly roll. Seal the edges. Place the roll seam side down in a well greased or parchment lined bread pan. Spray water on top. Sprinkle a little flour. Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in pre-heated 365 degrees F for 35-40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in pre-heated 365 degrees F for 35-40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from bread pan and cool on rack completely before slicing. Store in the refrigerator if not using up the same day.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from bread pan and cool on rack completely before slicing. Store in the refrigerator if not using up the same day.
